vectorField.invertSymbolsTip:
й_Draw the symbols in the opposite direction_______________________й.
й_By default, the symbols are displayed in the direction defined by the data. If the angle direction in the data is measured based on the beginning of the mass flow, such as wind, use this option to invert the vector symbol direction_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.

arcade.defaultExpressionScript_line1: й_Write a script that returns a value that will be used to draw features_____________________________________й.
arcade.defaultExpressionScript_line2: й_For example, find the percentage of oak trees________________________й:

tooltips.title: й_When to use ${title}_____________________й
tooltips.color: й_Use colors to represent your numeric or ranked data. Choose a theme that matches your data to a particular color scheme. For example, show data like age or income with the High-to-low theme that uses a simple light to dark color scheme_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colorDate: й_Use colors to represent your date data. Choose a theme that matches your data to a particular color scheme. For example, show data like age or income with the Above and Below theme that centers the ramp on a meaningful value such as an average or a goal________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colorAge: й_Use colors to represent the age of features. Age reflects the length of time from a start date to an end date. For example, show features less than 30 days old as green and more than 90 days old as red______________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.size: й_Use different symbol sizes to represent your numeric or ranked data. The larger the symbol, the bigger the data value____________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.sizeDate: й_Use different symbol sizes to represent your date data. For example, larger symbols could represent newer dates_________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.sizeAge: й_Use size to represent the age of features. Age reflects the length of time from a start date to an end date. For example, show data like new crimes with a large symbol and have the symbol decrease in size until it is 90 days old____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.type: й_Show different categories of features — such as type of tree, road class, or province name — with different colors. Some categories will not have an inherent order. For categories that do, such as educational attainment and income, consider using a sequential color ramp to visualize ranked categories________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.typeDate: й_Show different categories of features — such as years or days — with different colors____________________________________________й.
tooltips.color_Size: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent your numeric or ranked data. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your numeric or ranked data. This map style works particularly well when the first attribute is a rate, ratio, percent, index or similar type of data_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.color_SizeDate: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent your numeric or ranked data. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your date data as a continuous timeline______________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.color_SizeAge: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent your numeric or ranked data. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent the age of features____________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colorDate_Size: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent your date data as a continuous timeline. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your numeric or ranked data______________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colorDate_SizeDate: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent your date data as a continuous timeline. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your date data as a continuous timeline____________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colorDate_SizeAge: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent your date data as a continuous timeline. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent the age of features__________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colorAge_Size: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent the age of features. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your numeric or ranked data____________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colorAge_SizeDate: й_The first attribute you choose uses color to represent the age of features. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your date data as a continuous timeline__________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.type_Size: й_The first attribute you choose categorizes your data based on the unique values found, and uses color to distinguish them on the map. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your numeric or ranked data_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.type_SizeDate: й_The first attribute you choose categorizes your data based on the unique values found, and uses color to distinguish them on the map. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your date data as a continuous timeline_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.typeDate_Size: й_The first attribute you choose categorizes your date data based on the unique values found, and uses color to distinguish them on the map. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent your data___________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.type_SizeAge: й_The first attribute you choose categorizes your data based on the unique values found, and uses color to distinguish them on the map. The second attribute uses different symbol sizes to represent the age of features_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.predominance: й_Compare attributes that share a common subject and unit of measurement to see which has the highest value. Example: choose Corn Acres, Wheat Acres, and Cotton Acres to see which is the predominant crop in each area. Color shows the predominant category and transparency shows the relative strength of the predominance________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.predominanceSize: й_Compare attributes that share a common subject and unit of measurement to see which has the highest value. Example: choose Corn Acres, Wheat Acres, and Cotton Acres to see which is the predominant crop in each area. Color shows the predominant category, size shows the sum of the categories, and transparency shows the relative strength of the predominance____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.sizeForPredominance: й_Use different symbol sizes to represent the sum of all categories. The larger the symbol, the bigger the value_________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.chart: й_Compare the relative abundance of different categories of things at locations. Example: compare the relative proportions of different age generations in a country or state (gen-z, millenials, gen-x, and boomers)___________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.chartSize: й_Compare the relative abundance of different categories of things at locations and use size to capture the total amount or magnitude. Example: compare the relative proportions of different crop types (corn, wheat, soy beans, cotton) while the overall size of the pie depicts how much total crops are harvested____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.relationship: й_Use hybrid colors to view the relationship between two numeric attributes. Each attribute uses a distinct sequential color scheme to represent its classified data. Both schemes converge, allowing you to view and explore where the attributes may be related_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.relationshipSize: й_Use hybrid colors to view the relationship between the first two numeric attributes. The third attribute uses different sizes to represent your numeric or ranked data_____________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.location: й_Show the geographic boundaries, lines, or point locations of your data_____________________________________й.
tooltips.dotDensity: й_Use dot density to visualize the distribution of one attribute or compare multiple attributes. Choose the quantity that each dot represents. Example: 1 dot represents 1,000 people or 1 dot represents 20 trees__________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.heatMap: й_Show areas of high activity with stronger colors that appear to glow hotter_______________________________________й.
tooltips.compare: й_The first attribute is compared to the second attribute, and represented as a simple ratio, or as "A as a percent of B", or as "A as a percent of A+B." Examples: Revenue / Cost of Sale, or Corn Acres / Total Acres, or Corn Acres / (Corn + Wheat Acres)_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.stretch: й_Use a stretch renderer to enhance the visual contrast of data for analysis. An appropriate stretch renderer can enhance the contrast of imagery, allowing the user to control how their data is displayed for efficient imagery analysis______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.rgb: й_An RGB renderer is used to adjust the color bands of a multispectral image. Apply an RGB renderer to a layer to enhance feature visibility_______________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.classify: й_The Classify renderer displays thematic data by grouping cell values into classes. Use this type of thematic classification on continuous phenomena, such as slope, distance, or suitability, where you want to classify the range into a small number of classes and assign colors to those classes____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.uniqueValues: й_The Unique Values renderer is used to display each value in the image layer individually. For instance, you might have discrete categories representing particular objects on the earth's surface, such as those in a thematic layer, which could display soil types or land use__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.shadedRelief: й_Shaded relief renderer produces a grayscale or colored 3D representation of the surface on a layer, with the sun's relative position taken into account for shading the image. This renderer uses a hillshading technique for visualizing terrain determined by a light source and the slope and aspect of the elevation surface__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.vectorField: й_Use Vector field renderer to visualize flow direction and magnitude information in your raster with vector symbols___________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.colormap: й_A colormap renderer displays single-band thematic data based on specific colors, aiding in visual analysis of the data. Like the unique values renderer, the colormap renderer should be used to differentiate between classes or categories, but with a set of predefined colors from the associated colormap_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________й.
tooltips.flow: й_Motion helps to highlight both the direction and magnitude of flow in a field. Apply blend modes or layer effects to further enhance the lines_________________________________________________________________________й.

transparency.transparencyLabel: й_Set transparency based on attribute values______________________й
transparency.transparencyLabelPredominance: й_Set transparency based on the predominant percentage___________________________й

themeButton.highToLowMsg: й_Vary the size of features from high to low_______________________й.
themeButton.aboveMsg: й_Emphasize data above a key value like zero or the average______________________________й.
themeButton.belowMsg: й_Emphasize data below a key value like zero or the average______________________________й.
themeButton.newToOldMsg: й_Vary the size of features from new to old______________________й.
themeButton.beforeMsg: й_Emphasize data before a key date__________________й.
themeButton.afterMsg: й_Emphasize data after a key date_________________й.

color.aboveAndBelowMsg: й_Show data above and below a value like zero or the average_______________________________й.
color.centeredMsg: й_Center on and highlight a particular range of values____________________________й.
color.beforeAndAfterMsg: й_Show dates before and after a given date______________________й.

methodButton.naturalBreaksMsg: й_Create classes based on the natural grouping of the data______________________________й.
methodButton.standardDeviationMsg: й_Create classes above and below the mean using the standard deviation____________________________________й.
methodButton.quantileMsg: й_Create classes with the same number of features_________________________й.
methodButton.definedIntervalMsg: й_Create classes with given interval width______________________й.

defaultSymbol.showDefaultSymbolClassed: й_Show features with out of range or no values_______________________й
defaultSymbol.label: й_Label___________й

stretchTypeOptionDescriptions.none: й_Displays values between the potential minimum and maximum______________________________й.
stretchTypeOptionDescriptions.minimumMaximum: й_Displays values between the actual minimum and maximum_____________________________й.
stretchTypeOptionDescriptions.percentClip: й_Cut off percentages of highest and lowest values__________________________й.
stretchTypeOptionDescriptions.standardDeviation: й_Displays values between a specified number of standard deviations__________________________________й.

relationshipFocusButton.focusNoneMsg: й_The legend is a square with no focus on a particular corner_______________________________й.
relationshipFocusButton.focusHighHighMsg: й_The legend is a diamond, focusing on features with high values for both fields_________________________________________й.
relationshipFocusButton.focusHighLowMsg: й_The legend is a diamond, focusing on features with high values in the first field and low values in the second field____________________________________________________________й.
relationshipFocusButton.focusLowHighMsg: й_The legend is a diamond, focusing on features with low values in the first and high values in the second field_________________________________________________________й.
relationshipFocusButton.focusLowLowMsg: й_The legend is a diamond, focusing on features with low values for both fields________________________________________й.
